website_summaries.verdict: Improves spine alignment and helps correct poor posture and resulting neck stiffness: a helpful tool for persons who spend a lot of time hunched over a desk or computer.
pros: An FDA approved brace to help alleviate the pain, soreness, and stiffness of cervical spondylosis, cervical disease, neck injuries, or poor posture, the Leawell neck cervical traction device adjusts for the size and build of a frail, smaller person, or expands to accommodate the needs of a more substantial set person with a thicker muscular neck
cons: The collar width is not adjustable, making the chin support cumbersome and unnecessarily confining for use by a person with a small frame or short neck

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful and supporting.
customer_reviews.text: My mothe suffers from spondilytis and this neck support has proved to be a boon for her. The material is soft. The pump is removable after filling air in the pillow and it has a wheel lock which does not let air flow out after removing the pump. It is extemely supportive for the neck and its fitting size can be adjusted with the velcro straps. The only drawback is the air pipe cannot be removed and keeps hanging with the pillow. Apart from this fact, it's a great product and would recommend for people having cervical issues.

customer_reviews.title: A solid deal and maybe a great travel pillow.
customer_reviews.text: While I actually purchased this to use as a travel pillow, it seems very effective as a traction device. It goes from very flat to much taller than my neck with enough pumps of the bulb. One thing I am not a big fan of is the way you have to release the pressure. In order to deflate the device, you must remove the inflation bulb from the inflation hose. Which, of course, means you must reinsert the bulb into the hose to inflate it again. Still, for the price it seems like a reasonable design decision.
